reviewText: WARNING! POSSIBLE SPOILERS!!I have seen every episode of Inu Yasha, and have read every single chapter in the Manga and I have to say you couldn't get a better ending. A spectacular job was done adapting the manga to the anime once again.  It was very faithful to Rumiko Takahashi's storyline.  What I loved most was the animators fixed a few "problems" readers had with the ending in the manga series: Koga was written out, so you had no idea what happened to him after his shards were taken.  In the final episode, you do! Secondly, Inu Yasha and Kagome FINALLY kiss in the anime! (yes i know they did in the movie but never in the episodes). This gave a much better ending (even if it was just a kiss).  True fans will not be disappointed with this finale.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just literally finished watching this online and can truly say this series went out with a bang. The season starts off strong and stays that way through the end. Loose ends are tied up, stories are resolved, and major characters don't make it to the end. Very Exciting and can't wait until this is released on DVD as a box set. You can bet that I'll be watching from beginning to end once they release the box set!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Yeah! Their FINALLY properly ending the Inuyasha anime, instead of leaving us hanging with no real ending to the anime, while the manga books continued on pass where the anime ended years ago. *lol*Though now I wish they'd continue animating Rumiko's other series, Ranma 1/2, so we can see the whole Prince Herb and Saffron battles, and Akane and Ranma's almost wedding. *lol*
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've watched inu-yasha since I first discovered it when I was 12 years old, this series is my hands down favorite anime and manga. I finished watching this on hulu, and I was so happy with how it ended, and that I got to see how everything ended.I can't wait for it to be available to buy, so that I can complete my collection.
summary: Love this, can't wait for it to be available to buy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I would love to be able to review Inuyasha, The Final Act...but wait!  I can't!  I gave it five stars, well, just because it probably will deserve five stars if I ever get to order it.What is Viz waiting for?  It has literally been years.  By the time it is released, everyone will be saying, "What? Inu-who? Oh yes, I remember my grandmother talking about that show...too bad she's not around for the release of 'The Final Act'."
summary: I wish I could write a review....

reviewText: All the episodes are available in Japanese with English subtitles by googling Viz Anime.  There are other sites that work well with SpeedBit Acceleration.In fact, the whole InuYasha series is there as well.
